meanings.definition: A slender threadlike structure, especially a microscopic whip-like appendage that enables many protozoa, bacteria, spermatozoa, etc., to swim.
meanings.sent1: The flagella of the bacteria help them move around in water.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, you can see the flagella of the tiny organisms waving.
meanings.sent3: The playful bacteria challenged each other to a flagella race in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The flagella of the sperm cells propel them towards the egg like tiny motors.
meanings.sent5: The flagella of the protozoa danced gracefully in the liquid environment.

meanings.definition: To whip or beat with or as if with a flagellum.
meanings.sent1: She flagellaed the cream to make it fluffy for the cake.
meanings.sent2: The chef flagellaed the eggs vigorously to create a smooth batter.
meanings.sent3: The wind flagellaed the curtains, making them sway dramatically.
meanings.sent4: His words flagellaed her emotions, stirring up memories she had buried.
meanings.sent5: The storm flagellaed the trees, bending them to its will.
